Have you set up a proxy in the registration steps?

Therefore you get no verification code.

posts.name: Vahid A
posts.cooked: Our problem is getting the registration code. I do it with VPN and I do not get the registration code…

How is a proxy or VPN going to help to receive an SMS or phone call, if blocked at carrier level?

Until there are alternative IDs instead of phone numbers, the possible solution is to register with a different phone number, i.e. one not subject to blocking/filtering and accessible through web gateway. Not ideal, but there could be a companion service to Signal, that would offer free phone numbers for SMS registration/use with Signal. This service accessible through web interface could use nonexistent new country code and thus a large pool of available phone numbers for use. Just an idea while phone numbers are required…

The problem is not about connecting to server signal in internet. I have both signal proxy and VPN. and everyone in Iran that have installed signal messenger earlier can use it.
the problem is that verification sms and call cannot be received in Iran (maybe sms service that signal use doesn’t work in Iran or its sms and calls are blocked by government) so Noone can use signal for the first time (I changed my phone and don’t access to signal anymore).
to solve this, signal should use another sms service for Iran or other verification method.

posts.name: SignalUser
posts.cooked:
I suspect (as the previous speaker has already mentioned) that Iran blocks the registration service to prevent new registrations.
Of course, this is significantly easier than blocking constantly changing proxies.
The goal must be to get a registration without a phone number requirement.
Otherwise they will always be one step ahead of us.

Maybe it is not targeting block of signal messenger. Maybe Twilio won’t deliver sms anymore. or blocking Twilio phone numbers. signal team should contact Twilio support team (I as a signal user cannot contact Twilio support team)

Censorship - How does registration work in censored countries? General Discussion
It seems Twilio is not working in Iran or is blocked by government for more than a week. Do you have any short time (using services other than Twilio with sms text that doesn’t contain “signal”) or long time plan (verification by email) ? https://community.signalusers.org/t/i-do-not-receive-the-verification-code-in-iran-even-my-friends-neither-by-sms-nor-by-phone

posts.name: Erin
posts.cooked:
Still getting reports from individuals in Iran that they are not able to receive SMS verification messages.

Is there any more insight into this issue / steps forward to address it?

posts.name: link ✦
posts.cooked:
It seems that since Jan 19 sending SMS to Iran is not attempted in the first place, only phone verification is used:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Server

Don't attempt SMS to iran (#355)

committed 05:13PM - 19 Jan 21 UTC
moxie0
+4 -0

link_counts.title: Don't attempt SMS to iran (#355) · signalapp/Signal-Server@b25da8c · GitHub

posts.cooked: I can confirm this, set up signal on my new phone and for a friend, both immediately switch to a voice call

is that voice call working?
are you able to receive the verification number via voice call?
Yep! All the devices I tested get the voice call almost immediately, we pick up and the computer voice says the verification code. The code also works and logs us into/ activates signal on the device
